Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Interface UserCommandsInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
Game
public interface UserCommandsInterface
This interface indicates that the implementing class can be used as an interface for the player actions called by the controller. It has methods for doing everything a player can do in the game.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void chooseBonusResourceType​(Resource resource, int quantity)
    Allows the player to choose which resource to get (if any) as part of the first turn's bonus resources
    void chooseJollyInput​(Resource resource)
    Allows the player to choose into which resource to turn a jolly in the production's input
    void chooseJollyOutput​(Resource resource)
    Allows the player to choose into which resource to turn a jolly in the production's output
    void chooseLeaderCard​(int pos)
    Allows the player to choose which leader cards to keep (after choosing two the rest are discarded)
    void chooseMarbleConversion​(Resource resource, int quantity)
    Allows the player to choose to convert a white marble resource into one from their conversions list
    void confirmProductionChoice()
    Allows the player to confirm the selected production for activation
    void discardLeaderCard​(int number)
    Allows the player to discard the leader card corresponding to the given number
    void endTurn()
    Allows the player to end their current turn
    void moveDepotContent​(int providingDepotNumber, int receivingDepotNumber, Resource resource, int quantity)
    Allows user to send some of the contents of a depot to a different one
    void payFromStrongbox​(Resource resource, int quantity)
    Allows the player to pay the development card cost by taking resources from the strongbox
    void payFromWarehouse​(int depotNumber, Resource resource, int quantity)
    Allows the player to pay the development card cost by taking resources from the given depot in the warehouse
    void playLeaderCard​(int number)
    Allows the player to activate the leader card corresponding to the given number
    void resetProductionChoice()
    Allows the player to reset the selected productions
    void selectMarketColumn​(int numScope)
    Allows the player to select a column from the market and take its resources
    void selectMarketRow​(int numScope)
    Allows the player to select a row from the market and take its resources
    void selectProduction​(int number)
    Allows the player to select a production for activation (STARTS FROM 1)
    void sendResourceToDepot​(int depotNumber, Resource resource, int quantity)
    Allows the player to send a resource obtained from the market to a specific depot
    void swapDepotContent​(int depotNumber1, int depotNumber2)
    Allows the user to swap the contents of two warehouse depots
    void takeDevelopmentCard​(CardColor cardColor, int level, int slot)
    Allows the player to buy a development card from the cardTable

  • Method Details

    • chooseBonusResourceType

      void chooseBonusResourceType​(Resource resource, int quantity) throws NotEnoughResourceException, WrongTurnPhaseException
      Allows the player to choose which resource to get (if any) as part of the first turn's bonus resources
      Parameters:
      resource - the type of bonus resource to get
      quantity - the amount of resource to get
      Throws:
      NotEnoughResourceException - if the player does not have sufficient bonus resources left to convert
      WrongTurnPhaseException - if the player attempts this action when they are not allowed to
      ParametersNotValidException - if the given parameters are not admissible for the game's rules

    • chooseLeaderCard

      void chooseLeaderCard​(int pos) throws WrongTurnPhaseException, LeaderNotPresentException
      Allows the player to choose which leader cards to keep (after choosing two the rest are discarded)
      Parameters:
      pos - the number of the leaderCard to choose (STARTS FROM 1)
      Throws:
      LeaderNotPresentException - if the number selected does not correspond to a leader card
      WrongTurnPhaseException - if the player attempts this action when they are not allowed to
      ParametersNotValidException - if the given parameters are not admissible for the game's rules

    • playLeaderCard

      void playLeaderCard​(int number) throws LeaderRequirementsNotMetException, WrongTurnPhaseException, LeaderNotPresentException, CardAlreadyActiveException
      Allows the player to activate the leader card corresponding to the given number
      Parameters:
      number - the number of the leaderCard to activate
      Throws:
      LeaderRequirementsNotMetException - if the player does not meet the requirements for activating the leader card
      LeaderNotPresentException - if the number selected does not correspond to a leader card
      CardAlreadyActiveException - if the selected card is already active
      WrongTurnPhaseException - if the player attempts this action when they are not allowed to
      ParametersNotValidException - if the given parameters are not admissible for the game's rules

    • discardLeaderCard

      void discardLeaderCard​(int number) throws WrongTurnPhaseException, LeaderIsActiveException, LeaderNotPresentException
      Allows the player to discard the leader card corresponding to the given number
      Parameters:
      number - the number of the leaderCard to discard
      Throws:
      LeaderIsActiveException - if the player attempts to discard a leader card they have previously activated
      LeaderNotPresentException - if the number selected does not correspond to a leader card
      WrongTurnPhaseException - if the player attempts this action when they are not allowed to
      ParametersNotValidException - if the given parameters are not admissible for the game's rules

    • selectMarketRow

      void selectMarketRow​(int numScope) throws WrongTurnPhaseException
      Allows the player to select a row from the market and take its resources
      Parameters:
      numScope - the index of the selected row
      Throws:
      WrongTurnPhaseException - if the player attempts this action when they are not allowed to
      ParametersNotValidException - if the given parameters are not admissible for the game's rules

    • selectMarketColumn

      void selectMarketColumn​(int numScope) throws WrongTurnPhaseException
      Allows the player to select a column from the market and take its resources
      Parameters:
      numScope - the index of the selected column
      Throws:
      WrongTurnPhaseException - if the player attempts this action when they are not allowed to
      ParametersNotValidException - if the given parameters are not admissible for the game's rules

    • sendResourceToDepot

      void sendResourceToDepot​(int depotNumber, Resource resource, int quantity) throws DepotNotPresentException, NotEnoughResourceException, BlockedResourceException, NotEnoughSpaceException, WrongResourceInsertionException, WrongTurnPhaseException
      Allows the player to send a resource obtained from the market to a specific depot
      Parameters:
      depotNumber - the number of the depot to which to send the resource
      resource - the resource to send to the depot
      quantity - the amount of resource to send
      Throws:
      DepotNotPresentException - if there is no depot corresponding to the given number
      NotEnoughResourceException - if there is not enough of the selected resource in waiting room
      BlockedResourceException - if the resource cannot be inserted in the target depot because it is blocked by a different one
      NotEnoughSpaceException - if the target depot does not have enough space to contain the given amount of resource
      WrongResourceInsertionException - if the target depot cannot hold the given type of resource
      WrongTurnPhaseException - if the player attempts this action when they are not allowed to
      ParametersNotValidException - if the given parameters are not admissible for the game's rules

    • chooseMarbleConversion

      void chooseMarbleConversion​(Resource resource, int quantity) throws ConversionNotAvailableException, NotEnoughResourceException, WrongTurnPhaseException
      Allows the player to choose to convert a white marble resource into one from their conversions list
      Parameters:
      resource - the resource into which to convert the white marble
      quantity - the amount of resource to convert
      Throws:
      ConversionNotAvailableException - if the player does not have access to conversion of white marbles to the given resource
      NotEnoughResourceException - if the player does not have enough white marbles to convert
      WrongTurnPhaseException - if the player attempts this action when they are not allowed to
      ParametersNotValidException - if the given parameters are not admissible for the game's rules

    • swapDepotContent

      void swapDepotContent​(int depotNumber1, int depotNumber2) throws SwapNotValidException, DepotNotPresentException, WrongTurnPhaseException
      Allows the user to swap the contents of two warehouse depots
      Parameters:
      depotNumber1 - the number of the first depot to swap
      depotNumber2 - the number of the second depot to swap
      Throws:
      SwapNotValidException - if the content of one or both of the depots cannot be transferred to the other
      DepotNotPresentException - if there is no depot corresponding to one of the given numbers
      WrongTurnPhaseException - if the player attempts this action when they are not allowed to
      ParametersNotValidException - if the given parameters are not admissible for the game's rules

    • moveDepotContent

      void moveDepotContent​(int providingDepotNumber, int receivingDepotNumber, Resource resource, int quantity) throws WrongTurnPhaseException, DepotNotPresentException, WrongResourceInsertionException, BlockedResourceException, NotEnoughSpaceException, NotEnoughResourceException
      Allows user to send some of the contents of a depot to a different one
      Parameters:
      providingDepotNumber - the number of the depot from which to take the resources
      receivingDepotNumber - the number of the depot to which to move the resources
      resource - the resource to move between the two depots
      quantity - the quantity of the resource to move
      Throws:
      DepotNotPresentException - if there is no depot corresponding to one of the given numbers
      NotEnoughResourceException - if there is not enough of the selected resource in the providing depot
      BlockedResourceException - if the resource cannot be inserted in the receiving depot because it is blocked by a different one
      NotEnoughSpaceException - if the receiving depot does not have enough space to contain the given amount of resource
      WrongResourceInsertionException - if the receiving depot cannot hold the given type of resource
      WrongTurnPhaseException - if the player attempts this action when they are not allowed to
      ParametersNotValidException - if the given parameters are not admissible for the game's rules

    • takeDevelopmentCard

      void takeDevelopmentCard​(CardColor cardColor, int level, int slot) throws SlotNotValidException, NotEnoughResourceException, WrongTurnPhaseException, EmptyDeckException
      Allows the player to buy a development card from the cardTable
      Parameters:
      cardColor - the color of the card to buy
      level - the level of the card to buy
      slot - the card slot in which to put the card
      Throws:
      SlotNotValidException - if the selected card cannot be inserted in the given slot
      NotEnoughResourceException - if the player does not have enough resources to buy the card
      EmptyDeckException - if there are no cards left of the given color and level
      WrongTurnPhaseException - if the player attempts this action when they are not allowed to
      ParametersNotValidException - if the given parameters are not admissible for the game's rules

    • selectProduction

      void selectProduction​(int number) throws WrongTurnPhaseException, ProductionNotPresentException
      Allows the player to select a production for activation (STARTS FROM 1)
      Parameters:
      number - the number of the production
      Throws:
      ProductionNotPresentException - if there is no production that corresponds to the given number
      WrongTurnPhaseException - if the player attempts this action when they are not allowed to
      ParametersNotValidException - if the given parameters are not admissible for the game's rules

    • resetProductionChoice

      void resetProductionChoice() throws WrongTurnPhaseException
      Allows the player to reset the selected productions
      Throws:
      WrongTurnPhaseException - if the player attempts this action when they are not allowed to

    • chooseJollyInput

      void chooseJollyInput​(Resource resource) throws WrongTurnPhaseException, ResourceNotPresentException
      Allows the player to choose into which resource to turn a jolly in the production's input
      Parameters:
      resource - the resource into which to turn the jolly
      Throws:
      WrongTurnPhaseException - if the player attempts this action when they are not allowed to
      ParametersNotValidException - if the given parameters are not admissible for the game's rules
      ResourceNotPresentException - if the productions' input does not contain any more jollies

    • chooseJollyOutput

      void chooseJollyOutput​(Resource resource) throws WrongTurnPhaseException, ResourceNotPresentException
      Allows the player to choose into which resource to turn a jolly in the production's output
      Parameters:
      resource - the resource into which to turn the jolly
      Throws:
      WrongTurnPhaseException - if the player attempts this action when they are not allowed to
      ParametersNotValidException - if the given parameters are not admissible for the game's rules
      ResourceNotPresentException - if the productions' input does not contain any more jollies

    • confirmProductionChoice

      void confirmProductionChoice() throws NotEnoughResourceException, UndefinedJollyException, WrongTurnPhaseException
      Allows the player to confirm the selected production for activation
      Throws:
      NotEnoughResourceException - if the player does not have enough resources to activate the selected productions
      UndefinedJollyException - if the player still has to choose which resources some jollies in the productions' input or output will become
      WrongTurnPhaseException - if the player attempts this action when they are not allowed to
      ParametersNotValidException - if the given parameters are not admissible for the game's rules

    • payFromWarehouse

      void payFromWarehouse​(int depotNumber, Resource resource, int quantity) throws NotEnoughResourceException, DepotNotPresentException, WrongTurnPhaseException
      Allows the player to pay the development card cost by taking resources from the given depot in the warehouse
      Parameters:
      depotNumber - the number of the depot from which to take the resource
      resource - the resource to take
      quantity - the amount of resource to take (and of cost to pay)
      Throws:
      NotEnoughResourceException - if the selected depot does not contain enough of the given resource
      DepotNotPresentException - if there is no depot corresponding to the given number
      WrongTurnPhaseException - if the player attempts this action when they are not allowed to
      ParametersNotValidException - if the given parameters are not admissible for the game's rules

    • payFromStrongbox

      void payFromStrongbox​(Resource resource, int quantity) throws NotEnoughResourceException, WrongTurnPhaseException
      Allows the player to pay the development card cost by taking resources from the strongbox
      Parameters:
      resource - the resource to take
      quantity - the amount of resource to take (and of cost to pay)
      Throws:
      NotEnoughResourceException - if the strongbox does not contain enough of the given resource
      WrongTurnPhaseException - if the player attempts this action when they are not allowed to
      ParametersNotValidException - if the given parameters are not admissible for the game's rules

    • endTurn

      void endTurn() throws WrongTurnPhaseException
      Allows the player to end their current turn
      Throws:
      WrongTurnPhaseException - if the player attempts this action when they are not allowed to
